result.execSummary:
The defendant Destiny L. Clinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharge on count 1 only.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Maintain fulltime emploment until restitution is paid in full, then   Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

No contact with victims Matthew Woller, Roger & Sandy Johnson, Wigwam Inn, Ronald Hintz, unless approved in advance and in writing by Agent.
Apology letters to victims, give to Agent first.
No contact with the  Co-defendants: Harlon & Tanner Raymond, unless approved in advance and in writing by Agent.
Comply with any assessments, treatments, or other programming, counseling as recommended by the Compas assessment and the Agent.
Parenting classes if needed or other programs as recommended by Agent.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments and or treatment, so agent can Monitor compliance.
Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 234 days credit. Eligible immediately for home detention, if eligible according to jail rules and Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

records.addlTxt: PSI Report shall be viewed only. It shall not be copied, scanned or imaged in any way. Upon the Portage County Corporation Counsel's office completing review of the Pre-sentence Investigation Report, the copy provided will be returned to the Portage County Clerk of Court office for shredding.
for Release Confidential Information signed by Defendant
(Original sent to Judge)
from Corp Counsel
from R. Sanderfoot

8:33 a.m. Defendant Destiny L. Clinton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Destiny L. Clinton in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed PSI report. DA Molepski states corrections on the record. Atty McFarland states minor clarification.  Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing today. Victim notifications were complied with by the State.  DA Molepski makes sentencing recommendation of Imposed/Stayed Prison at 5 yr In and 5 yr ES and 10 yrs Probation and restitution summary provided to the Court $1,938.00.  Atty McFarland recommends a Withheld Sentence with 6 to 7 years Probation, 234 days jail, and objects to the no contact with family members as recommended by the state. 9:25 a.m. Defendant attempts to make apologetic statements to the Court. Atty McFarland reads her written statements on her behalf. 
BTC: *******************PROBATION*********
Count 1: Felony: - Armed Robbery Party to Crime:  Impose/Stayed 10 yr Prison at Sentence at 5 yrs Incarceration and 5 yrs Extended Supervision - stayed:  10 yr Probation: Conditions:
Pay $1,938.00 restitution - joint/several.
No contact with victims Matthew Woller, Roger & Sandy Johnson, Wigwam Inn, Ronald Hintz, unless approved in advance and in writing by Agent.
Apology letters to victims, give to Agent first.
No contact with the  Co-defendants: Harlon & Tanner Raymond, unless approved in advance and in writing by Agent
Comply with any Assessments, treatments, or other counseling as recommended by the Compas and the Agent.
Parenting classes if needed or other programs as recommended by Agent.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments and or treatment, so agent can Monitor compliance.
Maintain fulltime employment until restitution is paid in full, then   Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time. 
Provide DNA sample.
Serve 12 months jail as condition of probation. 234 days credit. Eligible immediately for home detention, if eligible according to jail rules and Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Pay costs and DNA surcharge on count 1 only.

Count 2: Misd: - Criminal Damage Party to Crime: 2 yrs Probation, concurrent with ct 1: Comply with conditions in Count 1. Pay costs.
Count 6: Misd: - Resist/Obstruct Party to Crime: 2 yrs Probation, concurrent with ct 1 & 2: Comply with conditions in Count 1. Pay costs.
Count 7: Misd: - Criminal Trespass to Dwelling: 2 yrs Probation, concurrent with ct 1 & 2 & 6 : Comply with conditions in Count 1. Pay costs.

Court finds it would be financial burden to pay DNA surcharge on counts 2, 6, & 7.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 07-21-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Destiny L. Clinton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Destiny L. Clinton in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:44 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty McFarland makes statements re: his understanding of the plea agreement. 
Atty Molepske makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Molepske. 
Atty McFarland is satisfied and makes statements regarding pre-trial credit being applied to the conditional jail time. 
Atty Molepske concurs. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Counts 1, 2, 6 & 7 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1, 2, 6 & 7.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 3, 4 & 5 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be provided to the parties atleast one week prior to sentencing. 
Attorneys are to contact the Judicial Assistant this morning for the sentencing date. 

Atty Molepske moves to revoke the bond. 
Atty McFarland makes statements to the Court.  

BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.  Defendant is remanded to the Sheriff's Department.
Plea hearing at 05-08-2015 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Destiny L. Clinton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Destiny L. Clinton in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:41 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
3:42 p.m.  Detective Ostrowski is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Molepske.
3:46 p.m. Witness identifies the defendant and the record so reflects this.
3:54 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Mcfarland.
Re-direct by Atty Molepske.
3:56 p.m.  Witness is excused.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Atty McFarland

Defendant Destiny L. Clinton appeared by video. Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
